title: Job Vacancies at Rainoil Limited
content:
Rainoil Limited is an integrated downstream oil and gas company. A prominent player in the Nigerian industry, the company’s operations span across the downstream value chain i.e. Petroleum Product Storage, Haulage/Distribution and Retail Sales. Our primary products include Petrol (PMS), Diesel (AGO) and Kerosene (DPK).

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) LPG Plant Account Officer

Job Locations: Yenagoa - Bayelsa and Ikot-Ekpene - Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Full-time
Gender Preference: Female
Specialization: LPG (Gas)

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To manage the petty cash inflow and outflow of Rainoil stations and depots as well as maintaining accurate records/books on transactions.


Responsibilities


	Facilitates the availability of funds to meet day-to-day operational petty cash expenses and emergencies.
	Maintains records to allow easy disbursement, reconciliation, and replenishment.
	Processes expense retirement ledgers to ensure proper accountability of all cash advances.
	Creates and maintains records of cash requests and disbursements.
	Reconciles all received cash, which have been recorded in the petty cash book, with expenses.
	Processes payment for accounts and issuing receipts.
	Keeps records of amounts received and paid, and regularly checking the cash balance against this record.
	Collects money from bank for safe keeping before reimbursements.
	Files all documents concerning cash payment and collection.
	Responds to queries regarding approvals, payment limits and deadlines for retirements etc.
	Retires the various imprest accounts.
	Prepares daily and weekly collections and payment summary reports for review by the station supervisor.


Requirements


	Minimum of an BSC/HND in Accounting, Banking/Finance & Economics.
	Minimum of One (1) year of work experience in a similar role.


Application Closing Date: 7th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: recruitment@rainoil.com using the Job Position and location as the subject of the mail

 


2.) LPG Plant Supervisor

Job Location: Yenagoa - Bayelsa and Ikot Ekpene - Akwa Ibom 
Employment Type: Full-time
Specialization: LPG (Gas)

Job Summary


	The candidate is responsible for overseeing the managing, operating and safety of the company’s Gas plant.


Key Duties


	Manages all Gas Plant operations as well as staff-related matters.
	Maintains excellent standards in all operational activity, driving sales and profitability through the effective deployment and development of LPG cashier and operators in line with approved budgets.
	Ensures that the due process is carried out in the discharge of products and puts in various controls to minimise fraud.
	Facilitates daily stock requests from the LPG terminal.
	Implement measures to ensure seamless and safe receipt, storage, handling, and dispatch of products in the plant.
	Facilitate regular facility inspection and maintain high standard HSE and implement maintenance controls/measures.
	Monitor and report on market trends, competitor activities, consumer preference to guide Rainoil LPG offering accordingly.
	Report on LPG sales / financial results to LPG Coordinator.
	Monitors and evaluates plant operational and marketing results and develops interventions to promote business development and growth.
	Evaluation of daily sales of LPG and lodgements
	Compiles and analyses periodic sales records and consolidates such reports to the LPG Coordinator.
	Manage all technical aspects of operations of the LPG plant including the storage facility.


Requirements


	Minimum of Second-Class Upper (B.sc) and HND Upper Credit in Engineering is required.
	Minimum of 1-4 years of experience.
	Honesty, commitment, hardworking and self-motivation.


Application Closing Date: 7th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: recruitment@rainoil.com using the Job Position and location as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Team Lead, Sales

Job Location: Delta

Job Summary


	This role involves developing strategic sales plans, analyzing market trends, identifying new business opportunities, and building strong relationships with clients.


Responsibilities


	Manage sales of petroleum products.
	Ensure excellent service delivery.
	Strategic planning and annual budgeting process
	Allocate resources as it relates to sales.
	Supervises activities of sales.
	Communicate performance target and monitor sales report.
	Monitor customer feedback and escalate customers’ issues.
	Present regular reports on sales activities.
	Performs excellent customer service in all operations. 


Requirements


	BSc in a Social science, Management, Accounting, Finance or Engineering or related discipline is required
	Minimum of 9 years working experience in the Oil & Gas, or related industry with at least 2 years in a managerial role preferably in a Marketing/operations unit of an organization in the oil & gas industry.


Application Closing Date: 6th December, 2025.

Manager, Membership and Branch Development Job at the Chartered Institute of Directors Nigeria




        
    

        
        The Chartered Institute of Directors Nigeria (CloD Nigeria) is a Membership Based Organisation (MBO) and Professional Institute which promotes corporate governance, directors’ development and capacity building, represents our members to government, enhances the economy for business development and provides services to our membership.
Founded on 17 May 1983, CloD Nigeria has been at the forefront of promoting good governance practices in Nigerian companies and the Public Sector. Through its various activities, CloD Nigeria had helped develop professional standard of directorship, and provided best practice guidelines for company directors to perform their duties effectively up to the international standards.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



The recently attained charter status of the Institute has expanded the scope of operations and services. There is therefore a need to fill a newly created role within the Institute.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, Membership and Branch Development

Job Location: Abuja (Northern  Zone)

Job Description


	The incumbent is responsible for the membership life cycle development in the Zone, including recruitment of new members, retention of existing members, and reactivation of dormant members.
	Execute and drive strategies and initiatives to grow the relevance and impact of CloD Nigeria in the Zone.


Academic & Professional Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Management or related discipline


Experience:


	Minimum of six (6) years of relevant work experience in similar role.


Competency and Skills Requirement:


	Leadership, coordination and organizational skills, In-depth knowledge of industry trends and ability to identify new opportunities for the Institute.
	Ability to think strategically and have drive for results.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Statement of Purpose (why you think you are the best fit for the position) and their current CV to: hr@ciodnigeria.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
